resources.string: Covering around 13 hectares, Dresden Zoo is home to more than 2,000 animals and over 300 species. The animal residents offer a fascinating journey through all the continents. Discover vicunas, nandus and capybara in the South America section, or Asian hoofed animals such as the rare mishmi takin and hog deer, as well as Asian small-clawed otters and orang-utans. And donâ€™t forget to stop by at the Tundra aviary or see the Australian red kangaroo!

The bombing of Dresden on February 13, 1945 also led the zoo to heavy destructions and destroyed almost the entire herd, but already in May 1946 took place the reopening. 1950 Wolfgang Ullrich applied for a support center, was once used as a Director and headed the zoo until his death in 1973. Since 1968, there is a zoo school.
Ticket Office closes 45 minutes before the zoo closes. \n *On 24.12 & 31.12 open to 15.00 and ticket desk closes at 14.00.
Please note that we can only admit children under 12 years to the zoo when accompanied by an adult.

Authors of this Android application: 
Chiyuan Gu, Furui Sun and Shuoyan Huang 
 
This app is developed as a group project for the course "Mobile Cartography" in TU Dresden, 2015/16 WS.

Map animal markers designing idea: freepik 
Menu icons: Google material icon 
Animal information: Wikipedia 
Content in the Introduction page are taken from Zoo Dresden official website: http://www.zoo-dresden.de
